titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Ardella Tibby papers LSC.2167

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-07-29 15:15:39 -0700.

did.abstract: Ardy Tibby is a lesbian feminist activist and organizer as well as an entertainer and author. Her collection focuses on her personal life and connections during her life in California and Phoenix, Arizona.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.
Collection contains 8 reels of 1/4-inch audio tape.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ardy Tibby Papers (Collection 2167). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Ardella Tibby was born on May 4, 1941. She became a teacher in the late 1960s and after coming out as a lesbian, joined the lesbian activist and cultural community. She began performing as a storyteller in festivals and community events, touring with artists such as Chocolate Waters throughout the 1980s and participating in the Califia community. She was a co-founder of the lesbian production group Delta Pi in 1984 which operated in Santa Rosa, California until 1989. She was the guest editor of Sinister Wisdom 80 entitled "Willing Up and Keeling Over: a Lesbian Handbook of Death Rights and Rituals." She has been and is currently involved with Older Lesbians Organizing for Change (OLOC), the Lesbian Archives and the Women's Circus. She resides with her partner Jean Taylor in Victoria, Australia. She refers to herself as a "proud, loud, bearded lesbian."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials relating to the life and activities of Ardy Tibby. The bulk of the collection represents 1970-1985, a time when Tibby was heavily involved in lesbian community organizations as an organizer, storyteller and participant. A large part of the collections is made up of photographs, journals and scrapbook pages covering Tibby's early life. Also included is a correspondence between Tibby and various friends and colleagues. Although there are some aspects of the collection that deal with logistics of Tibby's touring schedule, the majority of the materials are personal and community oriented.

controlaccess.subject: Lesbian activists -- California -- Los Angeles -- Archives.

did.physdesc: postcards held together with a metal ring

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This box contains postcards from friends and lovers, mostly sent from travel destinations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two bound books, one acted as an address book, the other is a daily calendar/diary that describes day to day activities and emotions.

did.physdesc: handwritten notes, printed paper, drawings, brochures

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder includes information about camping and music festivals. Includes correspondence between participants as well as promotional material for festivals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The bulk of this folder contains personal correspondence. Also included are flyers for feminist lesbian events and performers.

did.physdesc: postcards, bound diary, black and white photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains memorabilia from 1984 including a bound daily diary kept by Ardy Tibby as well as photographs and some correspondence.

did.physdesc: handwritten and typed paper held together by a metal ring

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains personal correspondence between Ardy Tibby and various friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Flyers for storytelling events featuring Ardy Tibby as well as newspaper clippings covering similar events.

did.physdesc: one spiral, one library bound book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Address books and daily diaries kept by Ardy Tibby.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains personal correspondence between Ardy Tibby and various friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence between Ardy Tibby and various friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder contains photographs of various sizes. Some color, some black and white and a number of them are mounted or otherwise framed. Most of the photographs depict vacations or celebrations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Personal calendars for Ardy Tibby from 1962, 1962 and 1966.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Four calendars, all published by the Rand Corporation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Three daily calendars for Ardy Tibby.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs of various sizes and formats. Occasional description on the back of individual photographs but no overarching organization or thematic separation.

did.physdesc: photographs, scrapbook pages, bound and typed manuscript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder contains pages from a scrapbook featuring photographs with handwritten descriptions. Also contained are report cards from elementary school and essays written for school credit.

did.physdesc: black and white photographs, handwritten notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains family photos as well as photos with Ardy Tibby and friends. Written materials are personal reflections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The label on the cassette tapes states "Side 1 File 1 Birth - 59GR" and "Side 2 File 1 JHS - young lesbian, repressed"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder contains scrapbook pages featuring photographs of teachers and classmates with accompanying descriptions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder contains scrapbook pages featuring photographs accompanied by descriptions. Most of the photos are of classmates or teachers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Spiral bound calendar with notes and activities described.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder contains photographs of various sizes depicting Ardy Tibby and her sorority sisters from several events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Large piece of canvas with drawing on it, folded and in plastic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written materials including reflections and correspondence from Ardy Tibby's year spent in Spain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder contains two different calendars containing notes on activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Teacher evaluations for Ardy Tibby as well as vacation photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings regarding sports teams and miscellaneous items of interest. Clippings are removed from their original publications, so dates and sources are not available.

did.physdesc: bound books, passport and plastic chips

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder contains miscellaneous personal materials including identification, Alcoholics Anonymous sobriety chips, autograph books from elementary school and a daily diary from tenth grade.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Flyers and brochures for various feminist lesbian events, gathering and services.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder contains correspondence with a number of Ardy Tibby's friends and lovers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This folder includes correspondence, diaries, calendars and hostel information from Ardy Tibby's travels to Spain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Postcards and handwritten notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pencil drawings of Ardy Tibby, unattributed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Original label states "Summer 1969-Summer 1970 USA + Canada Trip Jimmy's 16th Birthday, Mom + Jim's New House, Yucca Valley CAlifornia, Aunt Mattie Napa California - Book #4."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs of Ardy Tibby and friends.

scopecontent.p: Photographs of Ardy Tibby and friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs of Ardy Tibby and friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Flyers and brochures for various lesbian and women's events including readings, concerts and meetings. Some of the flyers are advertising storytelling and/or appearances of Ardy Tibby.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes four issues of Woman Rising, a women's periodical. Volume II No. 6 Nov-Dec 1977 Phoeniz, AZ Volume II No. 5 Sept-Oct 1977 Phoenix, AZ Volume II No. 4 July - August 1977 Phoenix, AZ Volume II No. 3 May - June 1977 Phoenix, AZ

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clippings collected by Ardy Tibby.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains two issues of The Lesbian Tide: A Feminist Lesbian Publication, written by and for the Rising Tide of Women Today September/October 1977 November/December 1977 Also includes a photocopy and a few clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Ardy Tibby and various friends and colleagues.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains newsletters from various organizations including Demeter, the Lesbian Herstory Archives and Lesbian Connection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Writings collected by Ardy Tibby including: A Radical Feminist's Response to Liberal Feminism by Mia Albright The Bearded Woman's Exchange Country Western Fluff by Jean Johnson The Sweet Sting of Success by Rita Mae Brown from Mother Jones A Glance at Oral Communication in the Lesbian Feminist Counter Culture by Sandra M. Anthony The Day American Turned into Woman by Mia Albright In the Image of Woman by Mia Albright

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brochures, flyers, schedules and itineraries for various women's and lesbian festivals and pride events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains issues of Lavender Morning (for Lesbians) Vol. 2 Issue 1 Vol. 2 Issue 2 Vol. 1 Number 1 Vol. 1 Number 2 Vol. 1 Number 3 Vol. 1 Number 4 Vol. 1 Number 5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, set lists, financial documentation and flyers for the Womoon Change tour featuring Ardy Tibby as a storyteller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Ardy Tibby and her friends and colleagues. Includes some memorabilia including paper dolls and handmade photo frames.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Ardy Tibby and her friends and colleagues. Also includes some hand drawings and some postcards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Ardy Tibby and her friends and colleagues. Also includes handmade calendars.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs from vacation in Pismo Beach with Ardy Tibby and friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Both black and white and color photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Majority of the photographs in this folder are polaroids, but are also mixed in with other photographic formats.

did.physdesc: various clothing items, books and ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inventory – Ardy Tibby Box 11 T-Shirts Helaine Victoria Press Shirty made for Ardy Tibby by Caryl DeGroot Tribad Productions in Sonoma County shirt with air brushed portrait of Ardy Tibby made by Therese Bur Waikiki shirt shirt made by Amelia Glaser by Ardy Tibby Miscellaneous Cap with drawing by Catherine Clinger during a dyke gathering at Magnolia Acres (locally known as La Punta) Quilt made for Ardy Tibby by Dyke Witch and priestess Ffiona Morgan 1988 Logo for Delta pi, lesbian production company made out of stained glass Punky Brewster converse shoes Rolodex Contents – Note on the bag "Probably 95% of these are Lesbians. These were in my rollodex over an almost 10 year open ending in January 93" Guest book from Ardy's Guest Room of Home/Dyke Center in Santa Rosa, CA "Not everyone signed it, but its a nice something. The household functioned as a dyke space from Nov 1988-April 1944." Books Breast Cartoons by Yvonne Eldresse - signed by artist and given to Ardy Tibby 1988 Graphic Details by Bev Balliett and Patti Patton 1979 – includes photo of Ardy Tibby – signed by authors and given to Ardy Tibby Take me Like a Photograph : Writings by Chocolate Waters 1977 signed by author and given to Ardy Tibby A Scrap of Royal Need by Mia Albright 1980 Womyn/Friends a Book of Poems by Jean Sirius signed by author and given to Ardy Tibby 1979

did.unittitle: Midwest lesbian express tour with Chocolate Waters
did.physdesc: postcards, photographs, handwritten notes and printed flyers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Flyers, correspondence, financial information, contact information and promotional material for the Midwest Lesbian Express Tour featuring Ardy Tibby and Chocolate Waters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contact information for the Califia community as well as printed community resources.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous materials including paper olls, ahnd drawings, printed paper and handwritten notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Container list contained in box: Sinister Wisdom Issues 36, 38, 39, 45, 47; Common Lives, Lesbian Lives Issues 12, 14, 27, 32, 34, 35, 37, 39, 46; Conditions Issues 11/12 and 16; The Lesbian Issue: Essays from Signs, 1985.
